column4: Urgh.  Having a weird semi urgent issue.  I was working with something fairly critical in a VirtualBox session and than I switched tried to switch out and go into Firefox on my Host (Ubuntu) and got into Firefox, but somehow the Guest Virtual BOx session still has my mouse focus and I cannot get back to it.  I have also tried ALT+Tab with no avail.  I can get to a command prompt via keys and I have tried gnome system monitor but it
Its weird cause I am able to use the keyboard but ALT+Tab doesn't seem to work nor the mouse
wmctrl is a command you run in a terminal window (which you asked about)
no, you can porbably get to ctrl-alt-f1 though.  ctrl-alt-f7 brings you back
are you sure your window manager didn't die or something?
you wanted to use wmctrl -a remember?
see what the man page says.
do you mind if I PM you?  there is too much going on in here
better to stay in the channel so others can help and benefit too, just read your highlights and ignore the rest
you need to use window title afaik
